result.execSummary:
The defendant Diane Marie Montpetit was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Must report to Probation today (5/16/16).
Must follow rules of Probation.

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/cost to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay will result in civil judgment.
Must pay a $250.00 DNA surcharge to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay will result in civil judgment.
Subject to Work Release.  NOT subject to Good Time.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

May not vote or hold public office until civil rights are restored.  Other civil rights may be lost until restored.  
If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.  
No illegal substances.

timeConds.notes: Banked/stayed for use by Probation if necessary.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Diane Marie Montpetit
